author: marekm3498
content:
I have a quick question about system calls in geth and other clients. What is expected behavior in scenario when we had an empty system account in state (defined in genesis for example) and we execute system call.  This test is an example: https://hivecancun.ethdevops.io/viewer.html?suiteid=1694132987-3c03f699ab1c0c9aef45727ec9241f81.json&suitename=pyspec&testid=9&file=%2Fresults%2Ferigon_cancun-git%2Fclient-281f600c07ac0e51f8546ed55d9abb879101d93e048355042396225de8ac17cb.log#L41

1. System account should be removed because it is empty and it was touched (EIP158 rules)
2. System account should stay empty, but in the state trie.
?

author: lightclient
content: i think the behavior is not currently defined

author: lightclient
content: if we want to define it, i would say whatever is easiest - which i think would be 1) ?

author: marekm3498
content:
yes, from my debugging the current expectation of the test is 2) though. Which makes sense for 4788 with direct state writes, but 1) would be better for system calls ðŸ™‚

One edge case: So if any client would implement direct state writes (without system tx) for 4788 there will be need to add touch to system account to have the same behavior.
cc: <@583892532644151312>

author: lightclient
content: although empty touch is no longer possible on mainnet so it might make sense going forward to clear empty accounts?

author: parithosh
content: not yet, we'll get it up next week ðŸ˜„
